page.title: 09TRANSPORT AND LOCAL SERVICES
page.content: The only means of transport other than by private car is by bus.The A50 service Denbigh-Holywell travels via Caerwys and Babell with six journeys in each direction,the first one through Caerwys at 8.25 (Denbigh to Holywell) and the last one at 18.14 (Holywell to Denbigh). The Denbigh-Mold-Chester(B4)service also travels via Caerwys with two buses in both directions. The War Memorial Institute houses a doctors morning surgery. Other local services include a visiting Library van,a voluntary twice weekly meals on wheels service and a Friday refuse collection. A private Fish and Chip van stops at the town square on Thursday and Saturday evenings.
